6987776
Date: 8/3/2135 PCP:
Dr. Robert Xenakis
Attending: Dr. Kirk
Senior: Dr. Huerta
Intern: Dr. Dukes
CC: abdominal pain/n/v
HPI: 60F obese s/p exlap/TAH/BSO/appy/chole (Meyers/Hayes -7/25) c/b ventral hernia and recurrent SBO s/p exlap/ventral hernia repair with alloderm (Steves - 12/33), and partial SBO managed nonoperatively 12/34, and most recently 5/23-49. Pt reports that she had dinner last night about 6pm and had her last BM at 10pm (also last flatus). She began to experience N/V at about 11pm and had several episodes of NBNB emesis. Pt reports the pain is constant, and located adjacent to her midline incision. Pt felt that her ventral hernia was protruding more. She denies any diarrhea, blood in her stools, no dysuria. She has not experienced any fevers. chills, CP, SOB.
PMH:
Epilepsy Schizophrenia Diabetes mellitus type 2 Hypertensive disorder Obesity Sleep apnea Hyperlipidemia recurrent UTI
s/p exlap/TAH/BSO/appy/chole (Meyers/Hayes) (7/01) c/b ventral hernia and recurrent SBO s/p exlap/ventral hernia repair with alloderm (Steves) (12/33), most recently w/pSBO managed nonoperatively 12/34 duodenal ulcer s/p EGD/clipping (11/34 )
Medications:
citalopram 90mg tegretol 800mg qam 600mg qpm colace 100mg tid hctz 25mg lisinopril 45mg mvi perphenazine 16mg bid remeron 30 bid simvastatin 20mg qpm clonazepam 1mg qam, 0.5mg qafternoon and qhs seroquel 400mg qam and qafternoon, 800mg qhs metoprolol 25mg bid omeprazole 20mg bid vitamin D 400mg asa 81mg caltrate 600mg bid metformin 500mg bid potassium 20meq insulin NPH 18units qam insulin regular SS qam/qsupper

Studies:
Abd/Pelv CT: Mechanical small bowel obstruction with transition point within a large ventral hernia containing mostly ileum. There is a significant amount of retained stool within the colon which may indicate partial or early obstruction.
Impression/Plan: 59F p/w low-grade SBO due to adhesions v intermittently incarcerated ventral incisional hernia. Pt is minimally tender on exam, elevated WBC; CT showing mechanical SBO with transition point at ventral hernia.
- NPO/NGT
- IVF, foley, strict ins/outs, serial electrolytes. - Admit to WSA Team 4,Attending Dr. Kirk. - RISS and hold metformin/lisinopril while NPO. - Repeat CBC w/diff and U/A - Cont Cipro for UTI
Case was seen and discussed with Dr. Patrizia Scott, senior surgical resident.
